item.title: How I Got My First Bug Bounty (650$ for CVE-2024-6636)
item.description: Introduction One day, an anonymous brother asked me, “Are you interested in finding WordPress bugs?” And that’s how this CVE came to be. The “WooCommerce - Social Login” plugin for WordPress at version <= 2.7.3 is vulnerable to the ability to create new users with an “Administrator” role. Specifically, if the register function is enabled. In that case, the newly created user will have the default role(Subscriber), but any user without authentication(unauthenticated) can change this default role to any value including “Administrator”.
